posts.cooked:
Hey everyone, last night we started working on getting Pathplanner working with our robot, but it’s doing some funky things and we aren’t really sure how to move forward.

We made a simple test auto that just moves forward a couple feet. When running the robot it moves incredibly slow backwards and also starts to turn 180 degrees, then seems like a very poorly tuned PID on 180 degree heading then turns back to 0 degree heading perfectly at the end of the auto. It does go the right distance (just reversed) but is incredibly slow and obviously turns

We are using the advantagekit neo template with CANcoders and a pigeon 2.

Our code: GitHub - Team4021/2025Varsity: This is the real one, with advantage kit.

I unfortunately can not send a video of the issue, thank you for your help!

link_counts.title: GitHub - Team4021/2025Varsity: This is the real one, with advantage kit.

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked:
One potential issue?

public static final double wheelRadiusMeters = Units.inchesToMeters(4);
I believe that is correct tho? The wheels are 4 inch wheels, then that converts them into meters?
Does this happen in teleop as well? Even if it doesn’t, try to add or increase a deadband on your controller.
It does not happen in Teleop

posts.name: Nafi
posts.cooked:
We had the same rotation issues when we first tried PathPlanner!

Sometimes it wouldn’t move straight but rather in a diagonal, sometimes it would turn around 180 at the end. You can try tuning your rotational PID or putting a rotational target within your path.

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: Definition is for radius not diameter
Oh shoot, you’re right. Will get that changed. Maybe that is why it’s so slow?

By rotational target do you mean just change the ending heading? Thing is it shouldn’t be turning at all, it’s just a straight path no turns or anything. It turns towards 180 slowly, oscillates terribly then at the end turns back to where it started lol

posts.name: Nafi
posts.cooked:
Nah, rotational targets are a seperate entry you can add in PathPlanner. image 752×347 10 KB

image 752×347 10 KB

image 752×347 10 KB

Translation: Make sure you’re at 0 degrees once you’ve reached the 100% part of the path.
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: It’s expecting one wheel rev to travel around 24 inches. It’ll only travel around 12.
Oh duh, I remember that. We will try that in a couple hours and report back. Thank you!
